lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_.

Dukenizer is a desktop app for managing your tasks and taking notes on a Graphical User Interface (GUI). If you can type fast, Dukenizer can neatly organize your tasks and notes faster than traditional GUI apps.
For the detailed documentation of this project, see the [Dukenizer Product Website](https://codychew.github.io/ip/).
1. Ensure that you have Java 11 installed on your computer
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the _home folder_ for your Dukenizer.
4. Double-click the file to start the app, or run `java -jar <folder path>\duke.jar` in your terminal.

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
Dukenizer is a desktop app for __managing your tasks__ and **taking notes** on a Graphical User Interface (GUI). If you
can type fast, Dukenizer can neatly organize your tasks and notes faster than traditional GUI apps.
1. Ensure that you have Java 11 installed on your computer
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the _home folder_ for your Dukenizer.
4. Double-click the file to start the app, or run `java -jar <folder path>\duke.jar` in your terminal.
The GUI similar to the below should appear in a few seconds.
5. Type the command in the command box and press Enter to execute it.
e.g. typing `help` and pressing enter will show you all the available commands
6. Refer to the [Features](#features) below for details of each command.
> - Words in `<Arrow brackets>` are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
> e.g. in `todo <description>`, `<description>` is a parameter which can be used as `todo Dukenizer README`.
> - Date and time must be valid and the format must be followed.
Shows the full list of commands in Dukenizer.
Adds a To-do task with the given description to Dukenizer.
Adds a deadline task with the given description and speciied deadline to Dukenizer.
Adds an event with the given description and a specified time to Dukenizer.
Lists the items in your task list.
Marks the specified task in your task list as done.
- The item number refers to the number shown in the task list.
- The item number is a __positive integer__ starting from 1.
- `list` followed by `done 1` marks the 1st task as done.
Deletes the specified task from your task list.
- The item number refers to the number shown in the task list.
- The item number is a __positive integer__ starting from 1.
Example: `list` followed by `delete 2` deletes the 2nd task
Finds tasks whose description contain the given keyword.
- The search is case-sensitive. e.g. `hi` will not match `Hi`
- Search term need not be in full words. e.g. `he` will match `hello`
Adds a note with a given description to Dukenizer.
Lists all the notes in Dukenizer.
- `note Bob is 5cm taller` followed by `notes` lists the
Removes a note at the specified index.
- The note index refers to the number shown in the note list.
- The note index is a __positive integer__ starting from 1.
- `notes` followed by `RemoveNote 1` removes the first note in the

Adding a todo| `todo `
e.g.,`todo buy groceries`

Adding a deadline|`deadline /by `
e.g.,`deadline homework /by 2019-12-01 00:11`

Adding an event| `event /at `
e.g.,`event birthday party /at 2020-08-22 23:32`

Marking a task as done|`done `
e.g., `done 1`

Find tasks by description|`find `
e.g., `find assignment`

Adding a note|`note `
e.g.,`note i am taller than Bob`
* The Dukenizer program implements a Task Manager application. It performs task manipulations
* based on user commands. It consists of a TaskList object to store your tasks, a Ui object
* to handle user interactions and a Storage object to save and retrieve tasks in a list.
* Constructs a Duke object from a specified filePath. If a valid .txt file containing
* a TaskList is found, it will be loaded. Otherwise, a new TaskList object is created
* @param taskStoragePath Relative filepath for storing task list from project source.
* Returns a String response to the user's input.
output += c.execute(tasks, notes, ui, storage, noteStorage);
* Returns the exit status of Dukenizer.
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Represents a user command. Consists of an execute method where the command manipulates
* the TaskList object, Ui object and Storage object to achieve the desired outcome. Each
* Command will extend from this abstract class and have their own execute and isExit method.
* Returns a String representation of the response to that command.
* @param tasks TaskList object containing the list of tasks.
* @param notes NoteList object containing the list of notes.
* @param ui Ui object to output messages to the user.
* @param taskStorage Storage object for storing tasks.
* @param noteStorage Storage object for storing notes.
* @throws DukeException When user request is invalid for that command.
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, NoteList notes, Ui ui, Storage taskStorage, Storage noteStorage)
* Returns a boolean indicator for the Command to exit the program.
* Represents a Command to add a new Deadline object to the TaskList
* Constructs a command to add a deadline task with a String description and a String time.
* @param description String description of the Deadline Task Object.
* @param by          String due time of the Deadline Task Object.
* Creates a new Deadline Task and adds it into the TaskList. The Storage
* is updated with the latest Task and a relevant String message to notify
* the user on this addition will be returned.
* @param tasks   TaskList object containing the list of tasks.
* @param notes   NoteList object containing the list of notes.
* @param ui      Ui object to output messages to the user.
* @param taskStorage Storage object for storing tasks.
* @param noteStorage Storage object for storing notes.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, NoteList notes, Ui ui, Storage taskStorage, Storage noteStorage) {
* Returns false to indicate that the Command does not exit the program.
* Represents a Command to delete an existing object in the TaskList
* Constructs a command with a String value of the instruction to be further processed.
* @param secondArg String argument to specify the Task to delete.
* Processes the String attribute markItem to make sure that a valid Task number
* is given. The Task will be deleted from the TaskList if it is valid. Otherwise a
* DukeException will be thrown. The Storage is updated with this deletion and a relevant
* String message to notify the user on this deletion or exception will be returned.
* @param tasks   TaskList object containing the list of tasks.
* @param notes   NoteList object containing the list of notes.
* @param ui      Ui object to output messages to the user.
* @param taskStorage Storage object for storing tasks.
* @param noteStorage Storage object for storing notes.
* @throws DukeException If number is not a valid item number in the task list.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, NoteList notes, Ui ui, Storage taskStorage, Storage noteStorage)
//checks if second argument of instruction is valid
throw new DukeException("Please enter a valid item number from the list! Type 'list' to check"
throw new DukeException("Please only input 'delete <item number>' with no other inputs!");
* Returns false to indicate that the Command does not exit the program.
* Represents a Command to mark an existing object in the TaskList as done

public String execute(TaskList tasks, NoteList notes, Ui ui, Storage taskStorage, Storage noteStorage)
//check if second argument of instruction is valid
throw new DukeException("Please enter a valid item number from the list! Type 'list' to check"
throw new DukeException("Please only input 'done <item number>' with no other inputs!");

* Returns a help messsage for the list of commands.
+ "1) list -Lists the items in your task list.\n\n"

+ "2) todo <description>
-Adds a To-Do task with the description to your task list.

"
+ "3) deadline <description> /by <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm>\n-Adds a task with a description "
+ "and a deadline to your task list. E.g. deadline sample task 1 /by 2020-09-12 23:22\n\n"
+ "4) event <description> /at <yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm>\n-Adds a task with a description "
+ "at a specified time to your task list. E.g. event sample task 2 /by 2020-09-12 11:22\n\n"

+ "5) done <item number>
-Marks the task at item number index in your task list as "done"

"

+ "6) delete <item number>
-Deletes the task at item number index in your task list

"

+ "7) find <description>
-Finds all tasks in your task list with the description search term

"
+ "8) note <description> -Adds a note with the description in Dukenizer. E.g. note i am 1.8m\n\n"
+ "9) notes -Lists all your notes in Dukenizer.\n\n"
+ "10) RemoveNote <note index>\n-Removes a note at the specified index in your note list\n";

REM compare the output to the expected output
